data.title: TS Hunterseeker does not have trait of type `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Mobile`
data.body:
Currently on bleed the Tiberium Sun hunter seeker causes a crash when ordered to attack an enemy structure (I've only tested structures).

This is the exception log provided.

```
Tiberian Sun Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
on map 4483b26b389728f4172b7555ee2b7622452c9827 (Hot Springs by Westwood Studios).
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Actor does not have trait of type `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Mobile`
   at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.TraitContainer`1.Get(UInt32 actor) in c:\Coding\Repositories\Try2\OpenRA.Game\TraitDictionary.cs:line 142
   at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.Get[T](Actor actor) in c:\Coding\Repositories\Try2\OpenRA.Game\TraitDictionary.cs:line 90
   at OpenRA.Actor.Trait[T]() in c:\Coding\Repositories\Try2\OpenRA.Game\Actor.cs:line 219
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.MoveAdjacentTo..ctor(Actor self, Target target)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Traits.DemoTruck.ResolveOrder(Actor self, Order order)
   at OpenRA.Network.UnitOrders.ProcessOrder(OrderManager orderManager, World world, Int32 clientId, Order order) in c:\Coding\Repositories\Try2\OpenRA.Game\Network\UnitOrders.cs:line 305
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.Tick() in c:\Coding\Repositories\Try2\OpenRA.Game\Network\OrderManager.cs:line 177
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager) in c:\Coding\Repositories\Try2\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 467
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick() in c:\Coding\Repositories\Try2\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 499
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop() in c:\Coding\Repositories\Try2\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 623
   at OpenRA.Game.Run() in c:\Coding\Repositories\Try2\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 663
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in c:\Coding\Repositories\Try2\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 117
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in c:\Coding\Repositories\Try2\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 39
```

I believe the issues with the TS HS is already mentioned in #9521, but I saw no specific mention of the crash itself.

data.title: Fix sprite turret recoil.
data.body: Fixes #9587.

data.title: Recoil:  isnt working anymore
data.body: i really miss moving turrets while firing with tanks..

data.title: Overhaul IRC in preparation for the global chat UI
data.body:
The existing code didn't scale to multiple panels, so I have reorganized and simplified it in preparation for the lobby and ingame integration.

This mainly focuses on the backend code, but there are a few visible changes:
- Polished topic and op/voice status indicators.
- Correctly handles kicks and errors.
- Distinguishes between chat and notifications.

data.title: Make "select all units" work across screen/map again
data.body:
I noticed in the new release that 'q' no longer selects all units across the map (only across the screen). I couldn't find the commit that was responsible for this regression, but this PR addresses that.

I also made 'w' do less work if no units/classes are selected (no debug msg appears either)

The behavior now adheres to what's stated in the [wiki](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Hotkeys). Updated the line in settings to better represent what 'q' does.

Although I incorrectly stated that it selects "military units" instead of "highest priority".

Do you think 'q' should instead select "military units" ie a specific priority instead of simply the highest one?

Note: this makes use of "Game.debug()" which might not be desirable. I could remove that or replace it with some placeholder (e.g. Game.WriteLine()) that calls Game.debug() until a better solution is available. I'm personally OK with leaving it as is (using Game.debug()).

data.title: Fix case sensitivity issue in d2k sequence definitions
data.body: Game would crash on systems with case-sensitive filesystems when a support-power beacon appeared.

data.title: Enables Explored Map by default in lobby settings.
data.body: This can be done now since #6123 is fixed.

data.title: Implement some keyboard hotkeys for chat (TextFieldWidget)
data.body:
This implements #8301 and parts of #2794.

The first commits implements the features, the second is a refactor to clarify the code, remove redundancies and make it easier to modify/add to in the future. It's also more explicit in its behavior, especially with regards to some functions that were being called from conditionals.
Because of the refactor, I recommend reviewing the commits separately.

The implemented keyboard hotkeys in the text areas are:
- ctrl + left/right (navigate words) (cmd + left/right on osx)
- ctrl + backspace/delete (backspaces/deletes words) (alt + backspace/delete on osx)
- ctrl + u / ctrl + k (removes rest of line from cursor) (cmd backspace/delete on osx)
- ctrl + x (clears the whole line) (cmd + x on osx) (this is optional but I often use it, especially in text editors)

I don't have access to OSX, so someone has to test that it's working fine on OSX, and that the hotkeys are sane/expected behavior (coherent with how interface usually behaves in other apps/in the os)

Also, does home/end exist on OSX? should cmd + left/cmd + right behave like home/end instead? (edit: did the latter)

A third commit resets the cursor blinking which I think makes the UX much better
A fourth commit makes ctrl+x cut to clipboard instead of cutting to the ether.

data.title: Gets AttackMove to work with 'Defend' stance
data.body: Fixes #8184.

data.title: Dune 2 mod TODO list
data.body:
This is a list of all things that will be needed to create a dune2 Mod: (Not complete)
## Adding support for file formats:

required:
- [x] *.PAK (#9580) (Daragon Unpaker is also a good tool to open them)
- [x] D2 SHP Format 2 ( supported by openra) (FINALE.PAK)
- [x] tiles orientation issues implemented (#9723, #9770)
- [x] player palette remap (#9654, #9662)
- [x] *.ICN (in the d2mod)
- [x] *.VOC #10032 (Sounds, music?) (ATRE.PAK, HARK.PAK, HERC.PAK, INTROVOC.PAK, MERC.PAK, Ordos.PAK, VOC.PAK, XTRE.PAK)
- [x] *.WSA #6781 (FINALE_PAK, INTRO.PAK, MENTAT.PAK)
- [x] *.CPS ?? 
- [ ] *.FNT (?maybe some font) #11566
- [ ] *.PAL (BENE.PAL, INTRO.PAL, WESTWOOD.PAL, IBM.PAL)
- [ ] *.INI  (SCENARIO_PAK) (Old Missions)
- [ ] *.EMC
- [ ] *.CPS
- [ ] *.TBL
- [ ] *.MAP (ICON.MAP (textfile))

SOUND.PAK:
- [ ] *.ADL
- [ ] *.ADV
- [ ] *.C55
- [ ] *.DRV (some Drivers)
- [ ] *. PCS
- [ ] *.TAN
- [ ] *.XMI

maybe unnecessary:
- [ ] *.CFG  ( I guess we don't need the confic-files: Dune.CFG, Options.CFG)
- [ ] *.DAT (OneTime.DAT, Waveset.DAT)
- [ ] *.DIP (SETUPENG.DIP)
- [ ] *.ENG (CREDITS.ENG & ENGLISH.PAK ) // Maybe more Localisation files inside the pak's
## Tileset 
- [x] Create the Dune2 Terrain Tileset
- [x] add Crater
- [x] add Spice
- [ ] Add Spicebloom
- [x] Create Test map
## Add Factions
- [x] Adreides
- [x] Ordos
- [x] Harkonnen
- [ ] Imperator
## Add all Buildings:
- [x] Barracks
- [ ] Concrete Slab 
- [x] Construction Yard 
- [x] Heavy Factory
- [x] High Tech Factory
- [x] IX
- [x] Light Factory
- [x] Outpost 
- [x] Palace 
- [x] Repair Facility
- [x] Rocket Turret 
- [x] Spice Refinery 
- [ ] Spice Silos 
- [x] Starport
- [x] Turret 
- [x] Wall
- [x] Wind Trap
- [x] WOR
## add foot Unit
- [x] Heavy Troopers 
- [x] Light Infantry 
- [ ] Fremen
- [ ] Saboteur
- [x] Sardaukar
## add wheeled Units
- [x] MCV 
- [x] Quad
- [x] Trike
- [x] Raider
- [ ] Flaktrike from dune2tgp?
## add chained units
- [x] Combat Tank
- [x] Harvester 
- [x] Missile Tank
- [x] Siege Tank
- [x] Devastator
- [x] Deviator
- [x] Sonic Tank
## add Air Units
- [x] Carryall
- [x] Ornithopter
- [ ] missiles (make units shoot)
## Explosions
- [ ] explosions of units
- [ ] explosions of buildings
## Husks
- [ ] Carryall Husks
- [ ] Ornithopter Husks
## Special stuff
- [x] Deploy support / animation of the MCV 
- [x] Harvester can harvest Spice
- [ ] Harvesters can use a Spice Refinery (pos, orientation)
- [ ] Carryall can lift Harvester
- [ ] Carryall dops harvesters perfect at the Spice Refinery 
- [ ] Repair Facility can Repair units
- [x] add craters on concrete slabs 
- [x] add craters on dunes
- [x] add add footprints for the vehicles (like #5858, #11112)
- [x] fire and smoke animations on damaged vehicles
- [x] fire and smoke animations on damaged buildings
- [x] creation animation for buildings
- [ ] Death Hand
- [x] Sand Worm (Spawn, Attack)
- [x] Function to render pixels randomly (used for worms and sonic-wave missiles)
- [ ] Sand Worm (Look)
- [ ] Sonic-wave animation (Look)
- [ ] Add Fregatte to Starport
- [ ] Add typical Starport ordering #7055
- [x] fog of war
## add Audio
- [ ] add music
- [ ] add sounds of units (Move/Attack-Orders)
- [ ] The vocals are very short and mixed to senctence: maybe we need extra code here 
- [ ] add sounds for messages like (ordos unit destoryed)
## create fitting User Interface (grey #4275, orange #4274)
- [ ] create asstets for menu
- [ ] create HUD for normal gameplay
- [ ] create c&c like sized icons
- [ ] create mouse original courser
## Balancing
- [ ] Add price
- [ ] Add building time
- [ ] Add building range to Conyard
- [ ] Add view range to Buildings
- [ ] Add view range to units
- [ ] Add power consumption
## Techtrees for the Factions
- [ ] Add Techtree for Adreides
- [ ] Add Techtree for Ordos
- [ ] Add Techtree for Harkonnen
- [ ] Add Fremen, Deathhand, Saboteur related to the palace building
- [ ] Add Techtree for Impterator ?

data.title: Fix inverted TargetTypes test in Infiltrates order resolution logic
Visuals: aircraft landing before airfield when approaching from lower left
data.body:
Not sure if this is a consequence of air speed changes (see #9469) but I noticed this in the most recent developer version:

You order a yak to land on an airfield:
a) when it approaches directly from the left, it lands as it should be
b) when it approaches from the sides it visually already "lands" before it reaches the airfield and "scratches" the ground until it really stands still:
![yakairfield](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14364389/10374161/daaca2ee-6df1-11e5-828f-173c49bed8da.gif)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27267131-visuals-aircraft-landing-before-airfield-when-approaching-from-lower-left?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Make maps with creep.active to act like a normal bot
data.body:
It's boring to play against passive creep, and too advanced to make Lua stuff
This would let mappers build a lot of cool maps, and give units/buildings to the AI to make it hard to play against them.

Examples:
*AI with only nukes, and you have to move quickly and have multiple bases
*AI with only sea, but start with a lot of units
*AI start with many units and mcv
*fight between AI's and then winner vs player
etc..

The issues is also that many servers do not allow bots.. This way we can still play with bots and humans there...

data.title: Soviet 07
data.body:
Even after freeing the dogs and engineers, if your rifle soldiers from the start of the mission die, you loose the mission.

Probably makes more sense to end the mission if all your engineers die before reaching the cooling stations, rewiring the security or the actual reactor.

On bleed.
